p.span: Apple‚Äôs AI struggles somehow just got worse ‚Äî and Mark Zuckerberg just added even more talent to Meta‚Äôs new Superintelligence unit.

With the chief of foundation models, Ruoming Pang, leaving for Meta and others rumored to follow, an AI brain drain may leave the tech giant scrambling even harder to catch up to its already distant competitors.

p.span: Meta poaches Apple‚Äôs AI leader
Teachers' union launches $23M AI academy
Prepare for meetings using Google Gemini Apps
Moonvalley debuts filmmaker-friendly video AI
4 new AI tools & 4 job opportunities
Image source: Flux Kontext / The Rundown ‚Äî original image via Mark Zuckerberg on Facebook
Meta

Ruoming Pang, Apple‚Äôs head of foundation AI models, with a reported offer worth tens of millions ‚Äî alongside other new additions to its new Superintelligence unit, including OpenAI‚Äôs Yuanzhi Li and Anthropic‚Äôs Anton Bakhtin.
Pang led Apple‚Äôs 100-person foundation models group, shaping the AI behind Apple Intelligence and next-gen Siri features.
Meta‚Äôs offer reportedly included a compensation package in the ‚Äútens of millions,‚Äù joining the Superintelligence division led by Alexandr Wang.
The Apple departure follows internal tensions after leadership explored replacing in-house AI models with options from OpenAI or Anthropic.
Pang is not alone, with Bloomberg reporting that several engineers from Apple's foundation models group plan to exit for Meta or other competitors.

Apple Intelligence and the AI-infused Siri have been nothing short of a disaster, but Meta is still picking off Apple talent ‚Äî and leaving the tech giant even further away from any sort of internal turnaround. Meta‚Äôs poaching may be the headline, but the real story is an Apple AI brain drain coming to its lowest point.

span.span: The AI gold rush: Are you in or out?

p.span: HubSpot‚Äôs ‚ÄúAI For Business Builders‚Äù free guide shows you how to join the savvy entrepreneurs quietly leveraging artificial intelligence for real business growth ‚Äî with no P.H.D. needed.

span.b: This no-BS guide cuts through the hype, giving you:

a.span: Grab your free AI Playbook today

p.span: Image source: Reve / The Rundown
The American Federation of Teachers
with Microsoft, OpenAI, and Anthropic to create a national AI training hub that will prepare 400,000 educators to integrate the technology into classrooms across the U.S.
The academy will offer workshops, online courses, and professional development, with its flagship campus in NYC, and plans to scale nationally.
OpenAI is committing $10M in funding and technical support, with Microsoft and Anthropic also contributing to cover training, resources, and AI tool access.
Teachers will gain access to priority support, API credits, and early education-focused AI features, with an emphasis on accessibility for high-needs districts.

With AI rapidly reshaping both the workforce and the classroom, this partnership helps better equip teachers for being on the frontlines of a tech revolution for the younger generation. The academy‚Äôs success could influence how AI is taught, governed, and trusted in education for years to come.

td.h4: üìÖ¬†Prepare for meetings using Google Gemini Apps

p.span: In this tutorial, you‚Äôll learn how to use Gemini AI to prepare for meetings ‚Äî by analyzing your calendar, reviewing past emails, and researching participants to generate comprehensive briefings before every call.
Enable
‚Äôs Google Workspace in settings to connect Gmail and Calendar
Ask: ‚ÄúCheck my calendar for this week and show me all my meetings with participant details‚Äù
Review history: ‚ÄúSearch my Gmail for previous conversations with [name] and summarize our past interactions in [timeframe]‚Äù
Get strategy: ‚ÄúBased on my upcoming meeting with [name], our previous chats, and current [company] context, suggest 5 questions I should prepare‚Äù
After meetings, ask the AI to draft follow-up email templates based on the talking points you prepared and discussed.

span.b: Warp surpasses Claude Code on T-Bench

p.span: Warp just launched the first Agentic Development Environment, and it‚Äôs already surpassed Claude Code by over +20% on Terminal-Bench ‚Äî also scoring 71% on SWE-bench Verified to make it the best-performing AI coding agent on the market.
Long-running commands ‚Äî something no other tool can support
Agent multi-threading, running multiple agents in parallel all under your control
Deployment across the entire development lifecycle

a.span: Try Warp's SOTA agent for free

p.span: ‚Äî or for a limited time get 2.5x AI credits on paid plans.
Image source: Moonvalley
Moonvalley, a startup founded by ex-DeepMind researchers, just
Marey ‚Äî a filmmaker-focused AI video model trained exclusively on licensed content that gives directors granular control over scenes.
Marey is trained exclusively on licensed footage to avoid copyright issues that plague other AI startups, heavily sourced from indie filmmakers and agencies.
The model gives directors precise control over camera moves, character motion, backgrounds, and lighting, integrating directly into VFX workflows.
Pricing starts at $14.99 monthly for 100 credits, scaling up to $149.99 for 1,000 credits ‚Äî with each five-second clip costing roughly $1-2 to render.
The company has raised over $100M to date and launched Marey alongside Asteria Film Co., an AI animation studio acquired by Moonvalley.

As Hollywood‚Äôs AI anxiety peaks, Marey is a test of whether ethical AI can win over creators. With a ‚Äúclean‚Äù training set and a platform that acts as a precise director tool instead of a ‚Äúluck‚Äù based video slot machine, Marey could help shift AI‚Äôs narrative around tinseltown from existential threat to creative partnership.
